newsitem.title: UK: RUGBY UNION-FITZPATRICK HONOURED IN WORLD XV SELECTION.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-FITZPATRICK HONOURED IN WORLD XV SELECTION.

text.p: All Black captain Sean Fitzpatrick and two of his team-mates during New Zealand's first series win on South African soil last month have been included in a World XV chosen from the best players of the past 25 years.

Fitzpatrick, Jonah Lomu, Michael Jones and Australian lock John Eales are the only current internationals selected by British Lions manager Fran Cotton to mark the 25th anniversary of the Rothmans Rugby Union Yearbook.
New Zealand and Wales occupy 11 of the positions, with England failing to provide a single representative.

World XV - JPR Williams (Wales); Gerald Davies (Wales), Danie Gerber (South Africa), Mike Gibson (Ireland), Jonah Lomu (New Zealand; Phil Bennett (Wales), Gareth Edwards (Wales); Mervyn Davies (Wales), Michael Jones (New Zealand), Ian Kirkpatrick (New Zealand), John Eales (Australia), Gary Whetton (New Zealand), Graham Price (Wales), Sean Fitzpatrick (New Zealand, captain), Ray McLoughlin (Ireland).
